markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Feat 8"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Debilitating Dichotomy](/Feats.aspx?ID=6066) <actions string="Two Actions" />
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Concentrate" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=561" />
<trait label="Cursebound" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=800" />
<trait label="Divine" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=579" />
<trait label="Mental" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=647" />
<trait label="Oracle" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=817" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

**Source** [Player Core 2](/Sources.aspx?ID=227) pg. 140 <sup>1.1</sup>

</column>

---

You reveal a glimpse of the impossible conflicts between the [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=579) anathema behind your [curse](/Traits.aspx?ID=566), forcing you to reckon with another's conflicts as well. You and one creature within 30 feet each take 9d6 mental damage with a basic Will save, and the target is stunned 1 if it critically fails its save. You get a degree of success one better than you rolled for your saving throw. At 10th level, and every 2 levels thereafter, the damage increases by 3d6.
name: Debilitating Dichotomy
